comments.html:
OSPF: when all you have is a hammer, everything looks like a nail...

I'd postulate that the primary reason we don't have widespread adoption of IS-IS in open-source routing stacks is the lack of understanding of the OSI protocol in the OS kernels they run on.

However, now that many routing stacks are moving to userland packet forwarding (e.g. DPDK, VPP, etc), I'd call that a new opportunity to finally get IS-IS into the open-source routing community.
